info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 2:26PM PDT until July 25 at 5:30PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Minor flooding over recent burn scar caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of western Nevada, including the following county, Douglas and the Conner Burn Scar.
* WHEN...Until 530 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. Ash and sediment transport likely on and downstream of Conner Burn Scar with initial heavy rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 223 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Douglas County, including near or downstream of Conner Burn Scar. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Recent burn areas are more prone to flooding, debris flows, and rock falls. Plugged culverts, rocks and debris on roads, and water and mud over roads are common during moderate to heavy rains. Increased sediment and debris can lead to impacts in areas typically not prone to flooding. Use extra caution when traveling in or below recent burn areas. Impactful flooding and debris flows may be generated by 15 minutes or less of heavy rainfall.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON
